com.backyardbrains.audio
Class MicListener

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      com.backyardbrains.audio.MicListener
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class MicListener
extends java.lang.Thread

A specialized thread to manage Android's AudioRecord objects and continuously poll out information to an accompanying RecievesAudio interface.

Author:
Nathan Dotz

Nested Class Summary
 
Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

Method Detail

getAudioInfo

public java.nio.ByteBuffer getAudioInfo()
Deprecated. 

Called by AudioService.getAudioFromMicListener() to pull up ByteBuffer

Returns:
the audioInfo

start

public void start(ReceivesAudio svc)
An alternate to Thread.start(), which allows us to provide a service which implements RecievesAudio then start the thread as normal. This allows for run() to poll the implementing interface with new data from AudioRecord as it becomes available.

Parameters:
svc - the service that implements the RecievesAudio

run

public void run()
Get a new recorder, check to see that we can actually record, start recording, and then continuously read audio from the recording interface, while pushing it out to the receiving service that implements RecievesAudio (set in MicListener#start(RecievesAudio).

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread
See Also:
Thread.run()

requestStop

public void requestStop()
clean up AudioRecord resource before exiting thread.
